statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: MD Baltimore Co 68, Hartford 58
article.story: CATONSVILLE, Md. (AP) -- Brian Hodges scored 14 points, and Maryland-Baltimore County halted an eight-game losing streak with a 68-58 victory over Hartford on Sunday. Rob Gogerty added 13 points and six assists for the Retrievers (10-16, 5-13 America East), who clinched the ninth seed in next weekend's conference tournament in Binghamton, N.Y. Hartford (8-19, 4-14 America East), which has lost nine of 10 games, got 12 points apiece from Charles Ford and Brian Glowiak. The Hawks, who will be seeded tenth in the tournament, scored the first basket of the second half on a jump-hook by Sean Regan, then missed their next 14 shots from the field. UMBC took advantage of the dry spell, taking control of the game with an 18-1 run. Andrew Feeley got the first four points on an inside move and a short jumper, and Michael Knight contributed five points. By the time the Hawks' Trevor Goode converted a layup with 8:25 remaining in the game, the Retrievers had a 46-36 lead. Hartford hit 5-of-9 3-point attempts in the first half to go up 31-28 at halftime. UMBC used a 7-0 run midway through the first half to take a 19-15 lead. John Zito hit a pair of jumpers and Hodges canned a right-side 3-pointer. But the Hawks responded with a 10-0 burst for a 25-19 edge. Glowiak contributed five points to the comeback, starting the spree with a 3-pointer.
